test_cases.title: [BUG] Dashboard does not show up claude code output

primary_evidence.pr_body_contains: fixes claude json parsing issue shown in #122

test_cases.notes: Clear explicit reference in PR body. PR #123 states 'fixes claude json parsing issue shown in #122'. Root cause: improper parsing of file paths with @ symbol.

test_cases.title: [BUG] Claude output didn't show up in dashboard

primary_evidence.issue_body_contains: Should be fixed in #120 - you can open another issue if there are still issues with the behavior. Released 1.4.19 with the fix

test_cases.notes: BIDIRECTIONAL link: PR #120 explicitly states 'Fixes /clear and /reset behavior noted in #115' AND Issue #115 final comment states 'Should be fixed in #120'. This bidirectional citation increases confidence. Fixed bug where /clear command caused dashboard rendering failure.

test_cases.title: [BUG] Claude Code Not Found
test_cases.notes: BIDIRECTIONAL link: PR #54 explicitly states 'For issue #53' AND Issue #53 cites PR #54. This bidirectional citation increases confidence. Fixed Claude CLI detection when installed locally vs globally. Contributor WindChimeRan mentioned issue in PR.

test_cases.title: [FEATURE] Name Agents
test_cases.notes: PR #162 states 'requested in #160'. Implemented --name flag for omnara CLI to allow custom agent names in dashboard.

test_cases.title: [FEATURE] [DOCS] Architecture visibility in dark mode
test_cases.notes: PR #166 references '#165'. Documentation fix to improve diagram visibility in GitHub dark mode by enhancing text contrast.

test_cases.title: [FEATURE] allow user to set default agent for omnara

primary_evidence.pr_body_contains: Using config.json for omnara settings. With --set-default option #221

test_cases.notes: EXPLICIT link: PR #222 comment explicitly mentions '#221' in description: 'Using config.json for omnara settings. With --set-default option #221'. Combined with strong temporal match (120 seconds), this is a clear link.

test_cases.title: [BUG] Ctrl + Z = Dead

primary_evidence.note: Strong temporal alignment with high semantic similarity between titles

test_cases.notes: TEMPORAL + SEMANTIC match: PR #203 'handle ctrl z' merged ~300 seconds after Issue #189 '[BUG] Ctrl + Z = Dead' was closed. High semantic similarity in titles (keyword overlap: 'ctrl', 'z'). Combined temporal + semantic signals provide high confidence.

test_cases.title: [BUG] Mobile interface sync issues with Claude Code subagents

primary_evidence.pr_title: Fix mobile interface sync with Claude Code
primary_evidence.issue_title: Mobile interface sync issues with Claude Code subagents

test_cases.notes: Both temporal AND semantic - bug name matches PR title

test_cases.title: [BUG] Codex version is not reflective of installed version

primary_evidence.closing_comment: You're correct, Omnara is using it's own bundled version of Codex. If you upgrade omnara (pip install omnara --upgrade) to >= v1.6.13, the update message should not show up anymore.

test_cases.notes: True negative - NOT A BUG. Issue closed with instruction for user to upgrade their version (pip install omnara --upgrade). No code change or PR needed as this is a user-side configuration issue, not a bug requiring a code fix. The closing comment explicitly provides user instructions rather than referencing any code fix.

test_cases.title: [BUG] prompts from subagents aren't shown

primary_evidence.temporal_note: PR merged 1 day BEFORE issue opened (user didn't upgrade yet)
primary_evidence.closing_comment: in v1.6.12, the subtask permission options should be displayed in omnara
primary_evidence.note: Difficult case: Issue opened AFTER PR was already merged, but user had not upgraded. Closing comment 'subtask permission options should be displayed' has very high semantic match with PR title 'handle subtask permission requests'

test_cases.notes: TEMPORAL (reverse) + SEMANTIC + COMMENT match: This is a difficult case. PR #218 'handle subtask permission requests' was merged on Sep 9, but Issue #219 '[BUG] prompts from subagents aren't shown' was opened on Sep 10. The temporal match is reversed (PR before issue) because user hadn't upgraded. The closing comment states 'in v1.6.12, the subtask permission options should be displayed in omnara' which has VERY HIGH semantic similarity to PR #218 title. PR #218 also fixed Issue #187. Low-medium confidence due to temporal reversal and shared PR.

test_cases.title: [BUG] git diff view x button on mobile not accessible

primary_evidence.note: Can't find issue, might be an internal fix or unreleased

test_cases.notes: Internal fix - unavoidable miss (no GitHub trace)

notes: Corrected dataset based on manual GitHub verification. Key corrections: (1) Issues #115 and #53 are BIDIRECTIONAL links (both PR→Issue and Issue→PR citations), increasing confidence to 0.98. (2) Issue #221 has EXPLICIT reference in PR comment, not just temporal. (3) Issue #189 combines TEMPORAL + SEMANTIC matching with high confidence (0.85). (4) Issue #219 is a difficult TEMPORAL (reverse) + SEMANTIC + COMMENT match with PR #218, merged before issue was opened (user upgrade lag). (5) Issue #227 is true negative - closed as 'not a bug' with user instructions, no PR needed. Issue #188 remains an expected miss due to internal fix with no GitHub trace. 9 true positives, 1 true negative, 1 unavoidable miss.
